short_description: This function is used to find the result of overlaying two geometries.
long_description: This function is used to find the result of overlaying two geometries. Overlay operations include intersection, difference, union, and symmetric difference. It can be used to perform operations to prepare sets of geometries for use with LocationPointInGeometry.  geospatial from AFS, parse the format and output them into database relations.

input_tables.name: source
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains the source geometry information
input_tables.description: The input table contains the source geometry information

input_tables.name: reference
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains the reference geometry information
input_tables.description: The input table contains the reference geometry information

argument_clauses.name: SourceLocationColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the source table column that contains the polygon description in WKT format.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the source table column that contains the polygon description in WKT format.

argument_clauses.name: ReferenceLocationColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the location of the polygon description in WKT format.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the location of the polygon description in WKT format.

argument_clauses.name: ReferenceNameColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the names of the polygons.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the names of the polygons.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the source table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the source table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: OutputAll
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to include the result of non-intersection geometries in the output. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to include the result of non-intersection geometries in the output. The default value is 'false'.

argument_clauses.name: Distance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the distance by which to extend or decrease the polygon.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the distance by which to extend or decrease the polygon.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
